intro: Seseli elatum subsp. gouanii, commonly known as the Gouan's seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, often found in rocky or limestone soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
